title: Ebo Taylor: A Music Star from Ghana
summary: Ebo Taylor was a famous musician from Ghana who played guitar and made music called highlife. He was born in 1936 and lived to be 90 years old. His family said he has died. Highlife is a type of music from Ghana that many people love. Ebo Taylor mixed highlife with other music like jazz and funk. He inspired many other musicians in Africa and around the world. He played in bands when he was young and later taught music at a university. His songs, like Love & Death, became popular again with new fans. People in Ghana are very sad because he was a big star in their country's music.

background_read: Ebo Taylor was a musician from Ghana, a country in West Africa. He lived a long life and made music that many people enjoyed. Highlife music started in Ghana and uses instruments like guitars and drums. It often has happy rhythms and is played at parties and celebrations. Ebo Taylor learned from other musicians and shared his music with the world, helping others discover Ghanaian sounds.
